alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:14PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Orange and northeastern Windsor Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 114 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sharon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Strafford, Norwich, Thetford, Sharon, Thetford Hill State Park, Thetford Center, Hartford, Pomfret, Royalton, Fairlee, Thetford Hill, South Strafford, East Thetford, Union Village, Pompanoosuc, Ely, Post Mills, West Norwich, Union Village Dam Recreation Area and West Hartford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 2 and 17. Interstate 91 between mile markers 71 and 73, and between mile markers 75 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and southern Vermont.
